text: I'm Italian from Villa San Giovanni and
Calabria and I grew up in a very Italian
household my father and mother had a
beautiful loving marriage and I had an
older brother who was my best friend I
came to New York City when I was three
there's a young girl I always dreamed
that I would get married at the altar on
st. Patrick's Cathedral and I married a
Sikh and I got married in a good
daughter a Sikh temple and still my
heart is there I tease my husband I say
when we married 25 years very soon he
said we'll get married as Americans
I could go to st. Patrick's this is my
taxi my yellow girlfriend I call it I
spend more time with her and I spend
with my family some of the men don't
respect you sometimes I wish I had
boxing gloves on my side mirrors it's
tough
people ask why do I like driving a taxi
it's the freedom of being your own boss
and it's knowledge you learn the city
learn people's moods sometimes you're a
psychiatrist for people you're like a
bartender or a cop without a gun
unfortunately my distant relatives never
accepted my husband because he was
Punjabi and Sikh
so if they can accept him they can
accept me Sikh very much like the
Italians the family structure is very
much so
everybody gets together everybody loves
each other everybody's caring you name
it I cook it it's the same vegetables as
we cook in Italy but just with curry
instead of a garlic and olive oil it's
coming it's a same thing I like broccoli
rabe but I make it in socks so I make
spinach but I make it maybe with some
potatoes it should seize now encourage
everything is the same but the quickest
way to a man taught in any culture is
his stomach I think my heart is for job'
like my height is low he's Italian I'm
still Maria Provenzano and I'm not just
Maria Singh
